intro: Agrostemma bungeanum, commonly known as the yellow weed or Bunge's grass-pink, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers bloom from June to August. Agrostemma bungeanum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
